snippet: Italy has staggered its way through a skyrocketing migration crisis in the Mediterranean that has seen roughly 120,000 migrants rescued by Italian ships this year, while nearly 2,800 have died in shipwrecks or in transit.
abstract: Italy is establishing refugee holding centers and search-and-rescue programs due to skyrocketing migration crisis in the Mediterranean; roughly 120,00 migrants were rescued by Italian ships in 2014, almost triple the figure in 2013, while nearly 2,800 have died in shipwrecks or in transit, a fourfold increase; rescuers are now searching waters near Malta after reports that more than 750 people may have died in two shipwrecks.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Pozzallo and Augusta, Italy, and Lynsey Addario from Pozzallo.

lead_paragraph: Italy has staggered its way through a skyrocketing migration crisis in the Mediterranean that has seen roughly 120,000 migrants rescued by Italian ships this year, while nearly 2,800 have died in shipwrecks or in transit.

headline.main: Sicilian Town on Migrants’ Route Cares for the Living and the Dead
headline.print_headline: Sicilian Town on Migrants’ Route Cares for the Living and the Dead
